item.title: Kerberos
item.description: tags Network authentication, Cryptography resources Main page, Computerphile video Kerberos is a centralized authentication protocol that uses Symmetric encryption as its main way of ensuring Online privacy on a network with a trusted central entity (e.g. a corporate network). A central server must have long term keys for every user on the network. It uses these keys to securely issue session keys with other devices on the network thanks to a Ticket-granting server (TGS).
